text:
The WAR task should support the same nested manifest element as the JAR task. 
J2EE project builds may or may not need to include "Class-Path:" references in
the WAR manifest.mf to access libraries contained under the EAR root.  If not -
a default manifest suffices, if so - an external manifest is required.  

The JAR task allows use of a specified external manifest AND a nested manifest
element.  This allows the external manifest to exist or not, depending on
project requirements.  WAR requires it's existence (if specified) and fails if
not present.
creator: thomas.rosenbaum@harley-davidson.com

text:
As the manual states, the <war> task is an extension of the <jar> task and
therefore it suports the nested specification of a manifest.
